message.content:
<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write
<<<code>>>: BufferedImage resizedImage = new BufferedImage(IMG_WIDTH, IMG_HEIGHT, type);
Graphics2D g = resizedImage.createGraphics();
g.drawImage(originalImage, 0, 0, IMG_WIDTH, IMG_HEIGHT, null);
g.dispose();
ImageIO.write(resizedImage, end, new File("pr/"+ff[j].getName()));
<<<explanation>>>: The code you provided resizes the image using the resizeImageWithHint method, which sets rendering hints to improve the quality of the resized image. However, the issue lies in the ImageIO.write method. By default, this method compresses the image using a lossy compression algorithm, which can result in a loss of quality. To preserve the quality of the resized image, you can specify a higher quality setting when writing the image using the ImageIO.write method. For example, you can use the JPEGImageWriteParam class to set the compression quality to a higher value, such as 1.0 (maximum quality).
